gears.sidescroller.world.items

Class AbstractItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • gears.sidescroller.world.core.ObjectInWorld
      • gears.sidescroller.world.items.AbstractItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collidable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GearItem

    public abstract class AbstractItem
extends ObjectInWorld
    An AbstractItem represents any pick-up-able item in the game world which a Player can obtain. An AbstractItem is collected by the Player upon colliding, which removes the AbstractItem from its Area. A Player may then use the AbstractItem through their inventory.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • checkForCollisions

        public final boolean checkForCollisions(MobileWorldObject e)
        Checks to see if a Player collects this.
        Parameters:
        e - the MobileWorldObject to check for collisions with.
        Returns:
        whether or not the given entity collided with this.

      • doAction

        public abstract boolean doAction(Player whoUsedItem)
        This method is invoked whenever the user selects this AbstractItem from their inventory. Subclasses should override this method to implement behavior which should happen when the Player uses this AbstractItem. Note that an AbstractItem may be used in an Area different from its own, so use whoUsedItem.getArea() to reference the Area it is used in, not this.getArea(). Note that the AbstractItem is responsible for removing itself from the Player's inventory, if appropriate.
        Parameters:
        whoUsedItem - the Player who used this AbstractItem
        Returns:
        whether or not this could perform its action

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Subclasses should override this method to render this AbstractItem on the given Graphics context.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context to render on.
